title: Pre-auth buffer over-read in Dovecot NTLM implementation

profile.name: Open-Xchange
profile.about: Messaging, collaboration and office productivity software for service providers

additional_data.old_title: Pre-auth buffer over-read in NTLM implementation
additional_data.new_title: Pre-auth buffer over-read in Dovecot NTLM implementation

activities.message: Thank you for the detailed report. We'll look into this.

Oops, I forgot to attach the stack trace. 
```
Stopped reason: SIGSEGV
ntlmssp_t_str_i (message=0x57aba680, buffer=0x57aba6a4, unicode=0x0) at ntlm-message.c:34
34                      str_append_c(str, *p & 0x7f);
gdb-peda$ bt
#0  ntlmssp_t_str_i (message=0x57aba680, buffer=0x57aba6a4, unicode=0x0) at ntlm-message.c:34
#1  0x5664cfa8 in mech_ntlm_auth_continue (auth_request=0x57aba438, data=0x57a9a1b0 "NTLMSSP", data_size=0x48)
    at mech-ntlm.c:221
#2  0x56643a91 in auth_request_handler_auth_continue (handler=<optimized out>, args=<optimized out>)
    at auth-request-handler.c:696
#3  0x56634812 in auth_client_handle_line (
    line=0x57ab6137 "CONT\t1\tTlRMTVNTUAAD", 'A' <repeats 36 times>, "QUEAAEE", 'A' <repeats 28 times>, "CAABvcmFuZ2UA", conn=<optimized out>) at auth-client-connection.c:228
#4  auth_client_input (conn=<optimized out>) at auth-client-connection.c:311
#5  0xf7e0eddb in io_loop_call_io (io=0x57ab8640) at ioloop.c:713
#6  0xf7e10e5e in io_loop_handler_run_internal (ioloop=0x57aa29f0) at ioloop-epoll.c:222
#7  0xf7e0eed2 in io_loop_handler_run (ioloop=0x57aa29f0) at ioloop.c:765
#8  0xf7e0f139 in io_loop_run (ioloop=0x57aa29f0) at ioloop.c:738
#9  0xf7d670a5 in master_service_run (service=0x57aa2920, callback=0x566323b0 <client_connected>)
    at master-service.c:809
#10 0x56631f70 in main (argc=<optimized out>, argv=<optimized out>) at main.c:395
#11 0xf7af2e81 in __libc_start_main () from /lib/i386-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
#12 0x566321a1 in _start ()
```

Hi!

I tried to reproduce this issue with 2.3.10:

```
May 06 09:33:37 master: Info: Dovecot v2.3.10.1 (a3d0e1171f) starting up for imap, pop3, lmtp (core dumps disabled)
May 06 09:33:40 imap-login: Debug: Growing pool 'imap login commands' with: 1024
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: Loading modules from directory: /home/cmouse/dovecot23/lib/dovecot/auth
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: Module loaded: /home/cmouse/dovecot23/lib/dovecot/auth/lib20_auth_var_expand_crypt.so
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: Read auth token secret from /home/cmouse/dovecot23/var/run/dovecot/auth-token-secret.dat
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: passwd-file /home/cmouse/passwd: Read 2 users in 0 secs
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: auth client connected (pid=12548)
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: client in: AUTH	1	NTLM	service=imap	secured	session=/mLa8fSkpod/AAAB	lip=127.0.0.1	rip=127.0.0.1	lport=143	rport=34726
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: client passdb out: CONT	1	
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: client in: CONT<hidden>
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: client passdb out: CONT	1	TlRMTVNTUAACAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACAoAAerVeu1N7D9YAAAAAAAAAABIAEgAwAAAAAwAKAGQAZQB2ADAANAAAAAAA
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: client in: CONT<hidden>
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: Growing data stack by 65536 as 'auth-client-connection.c:310' reaches 17616 bytes from 12 allocations.
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: passwd-file(orange,127.0.0.1,</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>): Performing passdb lookup
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: passwd-file(orange,127.0.0.1,</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>): lookup: user=orange file=/home/cmouse/passwd
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: passwd-file(orange,127.0.0.1,</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>): Finished passdb lookup
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: passwd-file(orange,127.0.0.1,</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>): Performing passdb lookup
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: passwd-file(orange,127.0.0.1,</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>): lookup: user=orange file=/home/cmouse/passwd
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: passwd-file(orange,127.0.0.1,</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>): Finished passdb lookup
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Error: ntlm(orange,127.0.0.1,</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>): LM response length is too small
May 06 09:33:40 auth: Debug: auth(orange,127.0.0.1,</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>): Auth request finished
May 06 09:33:42 imap-login: Info: Aborted login (auth failed, 1 attempts in 2 secs): user=<orange>, method=NTLM, rip=127.0.0.1, lip=127.0.0.1, secured, session=</mLa8fSkpod/AAAB>
May 06 09:33:42 auth: Debug: client passdb out: FAIL	1	user=orange
```

as you can see it did not crash. Is there something I overlooked?

Hi, Could you run the PoC on a fresh Dovecot server? I just made a quick way to verify the bug. This crash is depended on memory layouts. 

Another crash PoC is to trigger the integer overflow on [response_length](https://github.com/dovecot/core/blob/191321cc5d3489f48697c7212cddca6e1023c65b/src/auth/mech-ntlm.c#L118). It's more 100% stable and unrelated to the memory layout. If you want, I can take times to develop that tonight.
I can try if I can see it in valgring.

Yeah. I can see the issue with valgrind

```
==20703== Invalid read of size 1
==20703==    at 0x175FD5: ntlmssp_t_str_i (ntlm-message.c:34)
==20703==    by 0x1405AE: mech_ntlm_auth_continue (mech-ntlm.c:221)
==20703==    by 0x12AD57: auth_request_continue (auth-request.c:653)
==20703==    by 0x133E2A: auth_request_handler_auth_continue (auth-request-handler.c:716)
==20703==    by 0x1226DF: auth_client_handle_line (auth-client-connection.c:228)
==20703==    by 0x122A21: auth_client_input (auth-client-connection.c:311)
==20703==    by 0x4D8B011: io_loop_call_io (ioloop.c:713)
==20703==    by 0x4D8E06D: io_loop_handler_run_internal (ioloop-epoll.c:222)
==20703==    by 0x4D8B29A: io_loop_handler_run (ioloop.c:765)
==20703==    by 0x4D8B176: io_loop_run (ioloop.c:738)
==20703==    by 0x4CB0E31: master_service_run (master-service.c:851)
==20703==    by 0x1204E1: main (main.c:396)
==20703==  Address 0xb183610 is 0 bytes after a block of size 2,048 alloc'd
==20703==    at 0x4031B65: calloc (in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==20703==    by 0x4D9A801: block_alloc (mempool-alloconly.c:368)
==20703==    by 0x4D9A433: pool_alloconly_create (mempool-alloconly.c:249)
==20703==    by 0x14068D: mech_ntlm_auth_new (mech-ntlm.c:241)
==20703==    by 0x128ECA: auth_request_new (auth-request.c:131)
==20703==    by 0x133742: auth_request_handler_auth_begin (auth-request-handler.c:551)
==20703==    by 0x122610: auth_client_handle_line (auth-client-connection.c:220)
==20703==    by 0x122A21: auth_client_input (auth-client-connection.c:311)
==20703==    by 0x4D8B011: io_loop_call_io (ioloop.c:713)
==20703==    by 0x4D8E06D: io_loop_handler_run_internal (ioloop-epoll.c:222)
==20703==    by 0x4D8B29A: io_loop_handler_run (ioloop.c:765)
==20703==    by 0x4D8B176: io_loop_run (ioloop.c:738)
```
While the issue CVSS score is high, we consider the fact that the NTLM component is not used widely and usually those setups are not exposed to internet either. Thank you for the excellent report!
We will publish this once the code is out, this will take about a month.
